page.description: You can use Alpha Anywhere's Data Binding features to automatically populate a repeating section with data from an external table.

section.description: For more on this subject watch this two part video: [Part 1], [Part 2], or follow the guides below.

section.title: About Populating Repeating Sections
section.description: Repeating Sections require slightly more complex data binding than, for example, a simple textbox control that is bound to a given field in a SQL table. Instead of being bound to a given field, repeating sections are tied to a table that is linked to a parent table using a OneToMany 'Link type'. The repeating section can then be used to display data in a child table of the table that the repeating section is bound to.

Repeating sections are frequently used to create an invoice or detail form based on a larger table. For example, say you have a table that defines a list of orders from different customers. A second table might display the details of the customers orders and a third table the details of the products that were ordered. A repeating section could be used to display product information about all of the products that were ordered by a given customer.

It is necessary to define a primary key in order to link two tables. A primary key references the name of a field that is present in both tables. For example, the 'order' table and 'order detail' table might share a field named 'OrderID'. This field could then be defined as the primary key linking the two tables. You can use a different primary key to link the 'order detail' and 'product' tables, like 'ProductID'.
